conclusion: Plan to calculate the electromotive force induced in the square coil using the formula for induced EMF.
The image shows a square coil with a side length of a, n turns, half in a uniform magnetic field B, perpendicular to the coil plane, increasing from B to 2B over time Δt.
The induced EMF in a coil is given by EMF = -n × (ΔΦ/Δt).
Magnetic flux Φ through the coil is given by Φ = B × A, where A = a^2.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is (2B - B) × a^2 = B × a^2.
Substitute into the EMF formula: EMF = -n × (B × a^2/Δt).
Since the direction of magnetic induction remains unchanged, the negative sign can be ignored, resulting in EMF = n × (B × a^2/Δt).
The induced electromotive force in the coil is n × (B × a^2/Δt).
